summary: This document is an email chain from September 2021 regarding a discovery request from the FBI Victim Services Division for the upcoming Ghislaine Maxwell trial. It involves a request for contact information for victims/witnesses/attorneys and a response from a Victim Specialist indicating most communications were lost due to a phone switch, with only one victim contact method provided.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as a subject of the New York investigation (SOD-NY-3027571) which is scheduled for trial on November 29, 2021.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as a subject of the New York investigation alongside Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: M.S.CJ.
persons.context: FBI Victim Specialist from the Miami Division Office who responded to the discovery request, stating that text messages were lost when switching phones and providing contact for one victim.

connections.description: Both are named as subjects of the same New York investigation (SOD-NY-3027571) which is scheduled for trial.
The Victim Specialist is involved in the discovery process for the Maxwell/Epstein investigation, tasked with providing victim contact information.

events.title: Maxwell Trial Scheduled Date
events.description: The New York investigation of Jeffrey Epstein/Ghislaine Maxwell (SOD-NY-3027571) is scheduled for trial.

events.title: Discovery Request Deadline
events.description: Deadline for FBI Victim Specialists to provide victim/witness/attorney contact information for discovery in the Maxwell/Epstein case.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division was actively gathering victim/witness/attorney contact information for discovery in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial as of September 2021.
A Victim Specialist from the FBI Miami Division reported that text messages with victims were lost when they switched to a new bureau cell phone, indicating potential evidence preservation issues.
The only specific victim contact method provided in the response was for a victim with a birth date of 7/26/1988, communicated via in-person contact.
The email chain highlights the procedural steps and challenges in compiling discovery materials for a high-profile sex trafficking trial.
